reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThey literally did not proof read this game at all.  You may find spelling mistakes in every 2nd or 3rd sentence.  Even look at the store page screenshots, there are quite a few uploaded there but you can see the one that shows a red menu and it has ilnesses" at the top..  that's the kind of mistakes.  Typical foreigners who do not know any better and could easily make the 100's of corrections to the spelling and grammer to make this game presentable.  Also from the looks of things I am only at the very first level of the game and there could be some really bad grammar choices down the road
date: but they should at least make the first hour of gameplay mistake-free.  I mean
recommended: considering it is written by non-english speaking developers...  They did a pretty decent job so far but there are a lot of mistakes to be corrected.  http://i.imgur.com/C2XVasZ.jpg  you life?  http://i.imgur.com/u6vJFiq.jpg keep in mine?\n\nBut that's not all.  The game is extremely complicated.  If you look at the screenshots you will see how diverse the gameplay is
hoursPlayed: it's like they thought of everything and included a rough draft of their ideas.  It's actually inspiring.  But more than anything it is confusing.  I still really have no idea how to attack an enemy.  At first
voteText: you are in the training zone and no enemies attack you so you are free to attack them.  I binded kicking and punching to '5' and '6' on the keyboard (the only options
helpfulPercent: as 1-4 are used for other items
votesHelpful: meanwhile I am using an Xbox controller for everything else) and the attacking doesn't seem to work as it should.  Very first possible sighting of an actual enemy and they just instantly kill you.  Then after death it enters this altered state where you need to find a campfire to escape and the enemies are faster and harder
votesTotal: but if you die again it doesn't even really matter
votesFunny: you wind up back at home anyway.  According to the game lore
commentsCount: you are sent to an alternate dimension http://i.imgur.com/9SyaKCj.jpg\n\nThey also seem to try to copy the lore of Pokemon...  The main character seems to look a lot like the Ash character from the series (although slightly creepier) and it's all about fighting the gym leaders.  Even the very first town is called Oak Town.  But I would think in those types of games you would have a bunch of minions but I haven't been introduced to those types of mechanics yet.  As much explaining as they have done
column16: it's just hard to understand how to play.  I can't honestly recommend this game
column17: but if you do end up with a copy.. try it out.  It's weird enough to play for a bit."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

NOTE: I was supplied with this key by the developer, this however did not affect the review.

Intro
Survive Me Miolhr is a RPG based on a zombie theme. It has graphics reminiscent of Nintendo DS Pokemon games, a slightly confusing sound, and gameplay that is just too confusing to make sense of.

Graphics
The graphics for this game are fine and I actually like them. However the graphics are hindered significantly by a cluttered HUD (Heads-up Display) and side menus that just take up the whole screen. It’s to the point where the user cannot even see the graphics, let alone enjoy them.

Sound
The sound is decent, it’s nothing special. The only issue I really had with the sound is that there was this an annoying barking noise that seemed to be part of the soundtrack and it only served to irritate me to the highest degree.

Gameplay
The gameplay is the weakest part of this game. It’s absolutely horrendous and atrocious to put it mildly. Basically, the game throws a storyline and gameplay information at you that is so hard to make sense of. It tries to stuff two hours of plot and gameplay tutorials into two minutes and it just does not work.

Pros & Cons
Pros:
•	The graphics are really cool and brought back nostalgia of Pokemon HeartGold and SoulSilver on the Nintendo DS.
•	The soundtrack isn’t too bad apart from the barking noise I described earlier.
•	The story has a lot of potential.

Cons:
•	The screen is too cluttered by text and menus.
•	The barking noise is extremely annoying.
•	The gameplay is near non-existent because it’s so hard to understand.

Overall Thoughts
This game is a disaster, just don’t even mess with it right now. However, in fairness, it is in Early Access and is self-admitting when it comes to the fact that it is far from a complete product. It has a ton of potential, it’s just up to the Developers on whether they want to make a proper foundation for that potential to flourish and blossom. As of right now, that potential is not being utilized properly.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Some feedback:
- Opening Menu: The Opening Menu to the game where you can choose to continue or start a game is so ugly and hard to read. What's with some of the fonts in this game?
- Graphics: Nothing seems to match. Everything looks like it's from a different game. I would say hire a real pixel artist but some of the sprites are okay. Also why are some of the characters transparent? The sun and moon look like they were found on Google Images. A lot of the text is unreadable at certain points.
- Gameplay: Character movement feels very stiff and slow, a lot of room for improvement. I personally don't want to play games that control like this. It was okay when Pokemon did it in the 90s but that was a long time ago. The game has tutorials and training, but the character dialogue is so hard to understand at times I can't follow a lot of it.

Hopefully it being in Early Access means something. Best of luck to the developer. I'll have to try this game again in the future and see how it improves.

Early Access Review

A 90's game in 2016? It's more likely than you think!

Survive Me Miolhr" is an RPG based game with a zombie theme. When I first played the game
date: it reminded me a lot of the old 90's Pokémon. Not only does the gameplay remind me of Pokémon
recommended: but the main character looks similar to Ash. At first
hoursPlayed: I had a great nostalgic feeling. However
voteText: I was very disappointed when I encountered one of the many bugs in this game. Despite the crashes and bugs
helpfulPercent: the similarities to Pokémon kept me motivated. I continued to play
